sub_topic: Probability of a certain type of crime occurring in a neighborhood
message_1: In a certain neighborhood, the probability of a burglary occurring on any given day is 0.05. If a resident in the neighborhood has been burglarized twice, what is the probability that they will be burglarized again tomorrow?
message_2: The probability of a burglary occurring on any given day is independent of past events. Therefore, the fact that the resident has been burglarized twice before does not affect the probability of a burglary occurring tomorrow. The probability that they will be burglarized again tomorrow is still 0.05.
